Alleppey, Kerala 4.8 /5 View 62+ photos Known For : Houseboats in Alleppey Alleppey Beach Ambalappuzha Sree Krishna Swamy Temple Alleppey, often referred to as the 'Venice of the East,' boasts a labyrinth of shimmering backwaters, lush paddy fields, and serene coconut groves. Its houseboat cruises offer an unparalleled experience, letting travelers glide on tranquil waters while witnessing the daily life of local communities. Just a short drive from Kochi, this enchanting destination provides an immersive escape into Kerala's unique culture and natural beauty.Things to Do: Houseboat cruises, visit the Alappuzha Beach, explore the Kuttanadu paddy fields, and attend the Nehru Trophy Boat Race.How to Reach: Take a 1.5-hour drive (around 53 km) via NH66 or travel by train from Ernakulam to Alleppey.Ideal Duration: 2-3 days.Places to Stay: Houseboats, lakeside resorts, and budget-friendly homestays. Idukki, Kerala 4.0 /5 View 39+ photos Known For : Hill View Park Idukki Arch Dam Kalvari Mount Idukki, nestled in the Western Ghats near Kochi, is a verdant paradise known for its captivating hillscapes, wildlife sanctuaries, and spice plantations. The district's arch dam, one of Asia's largest, and the panoramic views from spots like Kalvari Mount make Idukki a nature lover's delight. Its blend of serene valleys and rich biodiversity makes it an unmissable gem close to Kochi.Things to Do: Visit the Idukki Dam, explore the Periyar Wildlife Sanctuary, trek in the hills, and tour spice plantations.How to Reach: Drive 2.5 hours (around 110 km) via NH85 or KSRTC buses to Idukki.Ideal Duration: 2-4 days.Places to Stay: Hilltop resorts, eco-lodges, and traditional homestays. Kerala Kalamandalam, Thrissur 4.1 /5 View 5+ photos Kerala Kalamandalam in Thrissur is the venerable abode of traditional performing arts of Kerala, where art forms like Kathakali, Koodiyattam, and Mohiniyattam come alive. Established to preserve and propagate classical arts, it's not just an academy but a temple of learning that offers an insight into the rich cultural tapestry of Kerala. Visitors get an unparalleled experience witnessing the rigorous training, captivating performances, and the dedication of artists towards their craft.Things to Do: Attend classical art performances, participate in workshops, and explore the cultural museum.How to Reach: A 1.5-hour drive (around 75 km) via NH544Ideal Duration: 1-2 days.Places to Stay: Hotels, guesthouses, and homestays in Thrissur. Distance from Kochi: 107 km Read More 35. Thenmala, Kerala 4.4 /5 View 21+ photos Known For : Butterfly Safari Adventure zone Trekking Thenmala in Kerala is India's first planned eco-tourism destination, famed for its unparalleled natural beauty and well-structured visitor-friendly amenities. Nestled in the Western Ghats, it's a blend of leisure and adventure amidst pristine forests, rubber and tea plantations. The harmonious integration of cultural and eco-tourism activities makes Thenmala a unique travel experience.Things to Do: Enjoy boating in the Shenduruney Wildlife Sanctuary, visit the leisure zone with sculptural gardens and boardwalks, go trekking, and experience the treetop huts.How to Reach: Drive 4 hours (around 180 km) via NH66.Ideal Duration: 2 days.Places to Stay: Eco-lodges, treehouses, and nearby hotels in Thenmala and Punalur. Distance from Kochi: 175 km Best Time: December to February 7 Thenmala Attractions Read More 36. Fort Kochi, Kochi 4.6 /5 View 5+ photos Fort Kochi, often regarded as the 'Gateway to Kerala,' is an enchanting blend of history, culture, and natural beauty. With remnants of Portuguese, Dutch, and British colonial influences interwoven with local traditions, this coastal town is a melting pot of diverse experiences. From the iconic Chinese fishing nets to colonial-era buildings, Fort Kochi offers a journey through time, making it an essential part of any Kochi itinerary.Things to Do: Stroll along the beach witnessing Chinese fishing nets, explore the Dutch Palace, visit St. Francis Church, and indulge in the local art scene at the Kochi-Muziris Biennale.How to Reach: A 30-minute drive (around 12 km) via NH966B, or take a ferry.Ideal Duration: 1-2 days.Places to Stay: Heritage hotels, boutique stays, guesthouses, and homestays abound in Fort Kochi. Distance from Kochi: 12 km Read More Kochi is perfectly located for a traveller looking for weekend getaways in South India. This is why it attracts a lot of tourists, who visit Kochi as well as places around Kochi. Places to visit near Kochi are attractive and variegated - ranging from Hill Stations to Resorts to Picnic Spots. Among the places within 200 - 300 km from Kochi, the popular ones include Alleppey, Kumarakom, Munnar etc. These places take 1-2 day(s) and make for a perfect weekend getaway from Kochi.
